history.content:
The unit cap only applies if you are at your semester cap.

As a double-major, you can take as many classes as you want within your first 9 semesters. It is only if you are trying to enroll in a 10th semester does your unit count get checked.

I'm trying to do double major but the unit cap worries me if I will be able to enroll in classes. 

My current units taken (including the Spring semester) are 103 and over the Summer, I'm planning to take 2 courses which by the Fall, it would be 111 units. The total units that I have to take for both majors, I have to take around 44 units. I'm planning to take 5 courses during the Fall and jam the rest(6) in the Spring (yeah.. I know that would really be baaaaaaaaaaad). So I was thinking since I am doing double major that my max cap is 136 units, maybe I can take 4 in the Fall, 4 in the Spring and 2~3 with decal in the next Fall(which would be my 9th semester or 5th since I'm a transfer student). But if I take 4 and 4 in the next year, I will have 143 before my 9th semester. 

My question is since I can take one more semester, would the unit cap not prevent me from enrolling more units or they would?

If I wouldn't be able to register, then I have no other choice but to take 11 courses through one year..... which I hope I can avoid. 

Any suggestion?
history.subject: Unit caps and 9th semester.
